data.name: testInitializeAction.SqlScript
data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here that you want to run before each test method (unit test) in this test class is run.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */

data.name: testCleanupAction.SqlScript
data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here that you want to run after each test method (unit test) in this test class is run.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */ DECLARE @maxId INT SELECT @maxId = MAX(PhoneId) FROM Stores.Phone DBCC CHECKIDENT('Stores.Phone', RESEED, @maxId) SELECT @maxId = MAX(EmployeeId) FROM Stores.Employee DBCC CHECKIDENT('Stores.Employee', RESEED, @maxId) SELECT @maxId = MAX(StoreId) FROM Stores.Store DBCC CHECKIDENT('Stores.Store', RESEED, @maxId)

data.name: SinglePhoneEmp_PretestAction.SqlScript
SinglePhoneEmp_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here to exercise the database object that you want to test.
To test a stored procedure, invoke it here by adding an EXEC statement that has appropriate parameters.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */ DECLARE @PhoneXML XML(Stores.PhoneXMLSchema), @EntId UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, @RC INT SET @PhoneXML = '<PhoneNumbers> <Phone IsPrimary="1">9130089763</Phone> </PhoneNumbers>' SELECT @EntId = EntityPhoneId FROM Stores.Employee WHERE FirstName = 'Test' AND LastName = 'Test'
EXEC @RC = Stores.uspAddPhoneNumbers @Phone = @PhoneXML, @EntityPhoneId = @EntId, @IsStore = 0
SELECT @RC SELECT CAST(p.PhoneNumber AS VARCHAR), CAST(p.IsPrimary AS VARCHAR) FROM Stores.Employee e INNER JOIN Stores.EmployeePhone ep ON e.EntityPhoneId = ep.EntityPhoneId INNER JOIN Stores.Phone p ON ep.PhoneId = p.PhoneId WHERE e.FirstName = 'Test' AND e.LastName = 'Test'

data.name: SinglePhoneEmp_PosttestAction.SqlScript
data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here that you want to run after the test script is run.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */ DECLARE @UniqueId UNIQUEIDENTIFIER DECLARE @Phone AS TABLE ( PhoneId INT )
SELECT TOP 1 @UniqueId = EntityPhoneId FROM Stores.Employee WHERE FirstName = 'Test' AND LastName = 'Test'
DELETE FROM Stores.EmployeePhone OUTPUT deleted.PhoneId INTO @Phone WHERE EntityPhoneId = @UniqueId
DELETE FROM Stores.Phone WHERE PhoneId IN (SELECT PhoneId FROM @Phone)
DELETE FROM Stores.Employee WHERE FirstName = 'Test' AND LastName = 'Test'

data.name: MultiPhoneEmp_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here to exercise the database object that you want to test.
To test a stored procedure, invoke it here by adding an EXEC statement that has appropriate parameters.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */ DECLARE @PhoneXML XML(Stores.PhoneXMLSchema), @EntId UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, @RC INT SET @PhoneXML = '<PhoneNumbers> <Phone IsPrimary="1">9130089763</Phone> <Phone IsPrimary="0">8983879706</Phone> </PhoneNumbers>' SELECT @EntId = EntityPhoneId FROM Stores.Employee WHERE FirstName = 'Test' AND LastName = 'Test'
EXEC @RC = Stores.uspAddPhoneNumbers @Phone = @PhoneXML, @EntityPhoneId = @EntId, @IsStore = 0
SELECT @RC SELECT CAST(p.PhoneNumber AS VARCHAR), CAST(p.IsPrimary AS VARCHAR) FROM Stores.Employee e INNER JOIN Stores.EmployeePhone ep ON e.EntityPhoneId = ep.EntityPhoneId INNER JOIN Stores.Phone p ON ep.PhoneId = p.PhoneId WHERE e.FirstName = 'Test' AND e.LastName = 'Test' ORDER BY p.PhoneNumber DESC

data.value:

In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */ DECLARE @UniqueId UNIQUEIDENTIFIER DECLARE @Phone AS TABLE ( PhoneId INT )

data.name: MultiPhoneWIthCd_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here to exercise the database object that you want to test.
To test a stored procedure, invoke it here by adding an EXEC statement that has appropriate parameters.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */ DECLARE @PhoneXML XML(Stores.PhoneXMLSchema), @EntId UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, @RC INT SET @PhoneXML = '<PhoneNumbers> <Phone IsPrimary="1">+919130089763</Phone> <Phone IsPrimary="0">+918983879706</Phone> </PhoneNumbers>' SELECT @EntId = EntityPhoneId FROM Stores.Employee WHERE FirstName = 'Test' AND LastName = 'Test'
EXEC @RC = Stores.uspAddPhoneNumbers @Phone = @PhoneXML, @EntityPhoneId = @EntId, @IsStore = 0
SELECT @RC SELECT CAST(p.PhoneNumber AS VARCHAR), CAST(p.IsPrimary AS VARCHAR) FROM Stores.Employee e INNER JOIN Stores.EmployeePhone ep ON e.EntityPhoneId = ep.EntityPhoneId INNER JOIN Stores.Phone p ON ep.PhoneId = p.PhoneId WHERE e.FirstName = 'Test' AND e.LastName = 'Test' ORDER BY p.PhoneNumber DESC

data.name: MultiStorPhone_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here to exercise the database object that you want to test.
To test a stored procedure, invoke it here by adding an EXEC statement that has appropriate parameters.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */ DECLARE @PhoneXML XML(Stores.PhoneXMLSchema), @EntId UNIQUEIDENTIFIER, @RC INT SET @PhoneXML = '<PhoneNumbers> <Phone IsPrimary="1">+919130089763</Phone> <Phone IsPrimary="0">+918983879706</Phone> </PhoneNumbers>' SELECT @EntId = EntityPhoneId FROM Stores.Store WHERE StoreCode = 'STR04'
EXEC @RC = Stores.uspAddPhoneNumbers @Phone = @PhoneXML, @EntityPhoneId = @EntId, @IsStore = 1
SELECT @RC SELECT CAST(p.PhoneNumber AS VARCHAR), CAST(p.IsPrimary AS VARCHAR) FROM Stores.Store e INNER JOIN Stores.StorePhone ep ON e.EntityPhoneId = ep.EntityPhoneId INNER JOIN Stores.Phone p ON ep.PhoneId = p.PhoneId WHERE e.StoreCode = 'STR04' ORDER BY p.PhoneNumber DESC

data.name: MultiStorPhone_PretestAction.SqlScript
data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here that you want to run before the test script is run.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */ INSERT Stores.Store(StoreCode, StoreName, StoreAddress1, StoreAddress2, IsWarehouse, EntityPhoneId) VALUES ('STR04', 'Store 4 - Test', 'TestStore', 'TestStore', 0, NEWID())

data.name: MultiStorPhone_PosttestAction.SqlScript
data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here that you want to run after the test script is run.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */ DECLARE @UniqueId UNIQUEIDENTIFIER DECLARE @Phone AS TABLE ( PhoneId INT )
SELECT TOP 1 @UniqueId = EntityPhoneId FROM Stores.Store WHERE StoreCode = 'STR04'
DELETE FROM Stores.StorePhone OUTPUT deleted.PhoneId INTO @Phone WHERE EntityPhoneId = @UniqueId
DELETE FROM Stores.Phone WHERE PhoneId IN (SELECT PhoneId FROM @Phone)
DELETE FROM Stores.Store WHERE StoreCode = 'STR04'
